page.title: 01Landscape
page.content: The area lies immediately to the east of the village of{LONG STRATTON}(pop. 2000) and consists of an attractive{ {RURAL}landscape,{undulating}between 41m and 54m above sea-level. One small stream flows north-south draining to the R.Yare system.{FARMING}dominates the area and whilst many{fields}have been recently been enlarged, many old {hedges}remain intact, which together with numerous{coppices}and{deciciduous {woods}provide a habitat for wild birds and small animals.{COMMON LAND}with a large variety of wild flowers and areas of pond and marsh is to be found most extensively in{FRITTON}and also in Morningthorpe, Shelton and Wood Green. The parishes are linked by {minor roads,}supplemented by{farm {tracks}and{footpaths.}The busy A140 trunk road linking Norwich to Ipswich, cuts the North-West corner.
